Content_wSideColumn.Name: Program Details
Content_wSideColumn.Title: OYA Program Details
Content_wSideColumn.Abstract: Program details will give the youth a packing list of what they need to bring on their OYA trip. Also it deals with the layout of each day and what the youth may begin to expect.

fbookDisplayed.label: Number of facebook messages to display

Content_wSideColumn.BodyCopy:
View theÂ  OYA Summer Video to see OYA in action!

What OYA offers you!

  • Outdoor camping
  • Ropes and challenge courses
  • Horseback riding
  • Whitewater rafting
  • Firesides on gospel topics
  • Group activities and adventures that build long-lasting friendships

See how all of these exciting activities fit into our Agenda!

Arrival Time and Check-in

All participants should arrive on the BYU-Idaho campus on Monday between 1p.m. and 1:30 p.m. Check-in will be outside on the south side of the BYU-Idaho Center near the circle drive. Please park in the parking stalls south of the BYU-Idaho Center. Due to limited resources we are unable to accommodate early arrivals or late check outs.

This lot is only available during check-in and check-out time and is not available for overnight or long-term parking. Long-term parking passes are available upon request at check-ins. Be prepared to show your rain gear and water bottle at check-ins.
It is important for participants to be on time. After they check-in, they will immediately load their gear and board the bus for Badger Creek Ranch.

Departure

The program will conclude on Friday at approximately 3 p.m. Parents should meet their youth returning from Badger Creek Ranch outside the BYU-Idaho Center near the circle drive.

Activities


Prepare for OYA

OYA Printable Packing List

  • Please bring only the items on this list and label all of your belongings with your name and address. Please pay attention to the Rexburg local weather to make appropriate adjustments to packing lists.
  • Please do not bring video games or electronics of any kind. Cell phones will not be allowed during any scheduled activity time.
  • Please do not bring candy, gum, or other snacks to Badger Creek. These items cannot be kept in your sleeping tents due to the local wildlife. If you require regular snacks for medical reasons, arrangements can be made with your OYA counselor.
  • This list is not designed to encourage participants to purchase new things. Please use existing clothing. Army/Navy surplus, Deseret Industries, and thrift stores are excellent places to buy outdoor type clothing.
  • Please, follow the BYU-Idaho Honor Code's Dress and Grooming Standards for each clothing item. Bare feet, midriffs, tank tops (boys and girls), shorts, capris, flip-flops, etc. are NOT ALLOWED.
  • Visit the Registration page for OYA

After OYA

Keep your OYA experience alive with the following suggestions:

  • Write your thoughts about your experience in your journal.
  • Stay in contact with your friends from OYA. Create a Facebook fan page for your session.
  • Set goals about what you want to accomplish after OYA.
  • Pray for guidance on how you can apply what you learned from OYA.
